intro: Sunaptea cinerea, commonly known as the gray sunaptea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features gray-green foliage with a velvety texture, and its flowers are typically small and clustered in a spherical shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded forest environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
